pros: Helpful staff, staff have been willing to assist me to learn my position and work with me. Staff and management have been friendly. Benefits are within the industry norm and a bonus reward has been generous. I would recommend joining the organization and have told many friends and past co-workers about how much I enjoy the position.
cons: The complexity of the software and many different programs to research and enter information has been confusing at times. I am grateful for my background but still get confused at times.

cons: None, honestly. If there are any issues it's internally within someone's own department. I have had nothing but great experiences.

pros: Overall you have a flexible schedule, generous time off, most of the co-workers are nice, work from home, fair to good salary.
cons: Micromanagement, no opportunity for advancement, poor overall benefits (extremely high cost), the amount of paperwork that you are expected to do is ridiculous, constantly changing policies and procedures, supervisors and management that are out of touch and expect you to just handle the job, they say that they are there for questions, etc. but are never available. They act like you are bothering them and rush the conversation, backstabbing culture, unrealistic expectations of employees.

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Treats you like family great culture.
cons: No cons the the company is great.

review_title: I was under paid and I feel they treated my patient horrible, the hours were also not enough for me to complete my job.
pros: At least they were consistent in letting me and my client what exactly was going on about me not being able to get paid for working for her anymore, and that no other caregiver was coming out to care for her as soon as I left. I was disgusted at this point.
cons:
They treated my client in a disrespectful manner.
The pay rate did not match the job duties.
The hours did not match the timing of getting the job done.
I had more contact with payroll than I had with speaking to home health company, no questions or updates about the client I was working with.
No equipment was given to care for client.

job_title: RN Care Manager in Appleton, WI
pros: I felt that management considered my input and valued my opinions more often than not. I appreciated the mostly flexible schedule and could flex my days when needed. The management did not micromanage and they usually had my back when it came to controversial decisions.
cons: The work load is heavy for the nurses. All managers were social workers so it was difficult for them to understand the demands on the nurses or how to adjust those demands accordingly. The paperwork and authorizations were heavy for the nurses as well, and it was not usually spelled out how we were supposed to make those financial decisions. We had to figure it out as we went and hope that we were doing the right thing.

pros: Cronyism is explainable when relatives and friends with a wealth of experience are invited and hired. In the IT department proficient employees with great years of experience are dismissed in favor of nepotism. Unbearable working conditions and an atmosphere of coercion to resign are created for a targeted worker. As a result this employee resining in most cases.
cons: If the victim does not leave, managers are firing him or her out with baseless accusations. Not all victims endure the hostile work environment. Two programmers died under strange circumstances at that department. One of them very young who had no health issues suddenly died at work during lunch time in February of last 2019 year.

review_title: Great co-workers but management expects too much from employees.
job_title: RN Care Manager in Sheboygan, WI
pros: Great co-workers, good pay, good benefits.  Flexible schedule.
cons: Paperwork is impossible to keep up.  Management is starting to micromanage everything.  Favorites are chosen by management.  Management doesn't support the staff and the answer to everything is thats what the state wants.

job_title: RN Care Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Flexible schedule, coworkers are helpful , 401k match 3%, cell phone stipend, other corporate discounts. Free parking, no real dress code that enforced.
cons: Management in family care program is hot and cold from day to day. Health insurance continues to rise. The paperwork is very repetitive. Management does not listen to employees and thinks that a yearly gift card can fix all the internal problems.

pros: I believe in the mission... Respect, Dignity, Quality of Life, etc...
cons: Time and talents of employees are not appreciated.  Unrealistic demands are placed on individuals.  Work load is high, compassion does not exist.

pros: Wonderful coworkers, awesome mission.  The company does great work.
cons: The worst management I have ever seen in my almost 30 year career.  Human Resources does not care how mismanaged their departments are or how their managers treat people under them.  No raises and employees feel unappreciated.

review_title: Don't even think of working for Community Care
pros: Co-workers are extremely decent and caring people for the most part.
cons: Management is clueless, productivity standards are unrealistic, pay cuts, health insurance is poor and extremely expensive, recent cuts to retirement savings plans, expect you to work for free on your own time, no time for lunch or even bathroom brakes. Standard of care is being compromised. Lots of treatment denials. Company is bleeding money due to Walker administration. Run; don't walk away from this company!!
